item.title: five family members killed in alaska plane crash
item.description: five members of a single family were killed on friday when their light plane crashed onto railroad tracks near a small alaska airport, authorities said.

item.title: anthony weiner cancels wisconsin speech to democrats
item.description: representative anthony weiner (d-ny), who has denied sending a lewd photo of himself to a 21-year-old female college student over his twitter account, canceled a scheduled speech on friday at the democratic party of wisconsin's state convention.

item.title: yankees count on burnett as their no. 2
item.description: a. j. burnett, who has pitched well in four spring starts, will follow c. c. sabathia in the rotation, ahead of phil hughes.

item.title: war crimes suspect could be extradited tuesday
item.description: serbian officials vowed to track down those who helped hide ratko mladic, but their prime interest now is to get him packed off to the war crimes tribunal in the hague.

item.title: nato: gaddafi's forces to blame for oilfield fire
item.description: nato blamed forces loyal to muammar gaddafi for a fire in an oilfield in libya on thursday, and denied the western military alliance had launched air strikes in the area.

item.title: freddie mac's former chief may face s.e.c. action
item.description: fannie mae and freddie mac executives may face s.e.c. civil actions, but no criminal charges have been made.

item.title: wild fires destroy twelve homes in texas panhandle
item.description: wild fires fed by high winds and severe drought swept through seven high-end homes on the outskirts of amarillo in the texas panhandle on monday, bringing to 12 the number of residences destroyed by fires in the area over memorial day weekend.

item.title: "thor" gets summer off to thunderous start
item.description: the marvel universe moves into the cosmic realm with "thor," a burly slab of bombastic superhero entertainment that skitters just this side of kitschy to provide an introduction befitting the mighty god of thunder.

item.title: u.s. wants states to reveal more about pension funding
item.description: a federal board will soon propose that u.s. states disclose more about their pension funding as worries grow whether states and municipalities can pay for their employees' pensions.

item.title: u.s. accuses syria of inciting israel border clashes
item.description: the white house accused the syrian government on monday of inciting deadly border clashes between israeli troops and palestinian demonstrators, saying damascus was trying to distract attention from its own violent crackdown on protests.

item.title: clerk warns budget cuts could delay casey anthony trial
item.description: the may 9 trial for casey anthony, accused of killing her toddler, might have to be canceled or suspended if proposed state budget cuts go through, according to orange county clerk of courts lydia gardner.

item.description: classic stage company serves up 'double falsehood,' which might be a late-career collaboration between shakespeare and john fletcher or might simply be a fraud.

item.title: israel-palestinian violence erupts on three borders
item.description: israeli troops shot palestinian protesters who surged toward its frontiers with syria, lebanon and gaza on sunday, killing at least 13 people on the day palestinians mourn the establishment of israel in 1948.

item.title: acetaminophen tied to blood cancers
item.description: new research shows chronic users of acetaminophen, a top-selling painkiller known as tylenol in the u.s. and paracetamol in europe, are at slightly increased risk for blood cancers.

item.title: optimism is back, says top private equity deal-maker
item.description: scott m. sperling, co-president of thomas h. lee partners, says in a cnbc interview that the threat of a double-dip recession has lessened, and that key credit markets are 'as robust as we've seen' since the financial crisis.

item.description: tornado survivors in joplin, mo., say they're grateful to be alive

item.description: at least 24 people were killed in two separate bomb attacks in northwest pakistan on sunday, police said.

item.title: missile strike kills 6 militants in pakistan
item.description: a missile strike by a u.s. drone killed at least 6 militants in pakistan's south waziristan, intelligence officials said, the second such attack in the tribal frontier region in less than a week.

item.description: a decision on the playing future of notre dame wide receiver michael floyd could be handed down soon.

item.title: peter vidmar resigns as 2012 games chef de mission
item.description: peter vidmar resigned as chef de mission for the united states 2012 london olympics team on friday, saying he did not want controversy over his opposition to gay marriage to be a distraction to athletes.

item.title: floods push reptiles, other critters into the open
item.description: as mississippi river flooding rolls downstream, the rising waters are flushing a number of animals, including some of north america's most feared reptiles, out of their natural habitats and into uncomfortably close contact with people.

item.description: it may be a first in the annals of government secrecy: declassifying documents to mark the anniversary of their leak to the press.

item.title: boogaard is remembered by his 'billet mom'
item.description: as family and friends gathered for the funeral of derek boogaard in regina, saskatchewan, on saturday, boogaard was remembered in the context of a different kind of family - his last "billet mom," in medicine hat, alberta.

item.description: india has again denounced u.s. military aid to pakistan which it says is being used by islamabad against indian interests, local media reported on saturday.

item.description: sean penn plays a catatonic goth rocker in "this must be the place," a strange tale that follows retired pop star cheyenne from a life of luxury in ireland to a hunt for a world war two nazi camp guard in the united states.

item.title: china c.bank governor vows to make policy more flexible

item.description: mr. bernstein published a highly praised memoir of his poverty-stricken childhood in england at the age of 96.

item.description: emerging nations are still conducting "lots of consultations" about choosing a candidate from their ranks to head the international monetary fund, south african finance minister pravin gordhan said on tuesday.

item.description: mass school shootings fill tv screens with bloody images, newspapers with heart-wrenching accounts from terrified students, and pose searching questions about the motives of the young killers.

item.description: the european union will propose offering at least 150 million euros ($219 million) in compensation to farmers affected by the e.coli outbreak, the european commissioner for agriculture said on tuesday.
